{{Infobox software | name = Enigmail | logo = | screenshot = [[File:SignedAndEncryptedMessage.png|center|250px]] | caption = Signed and encrypted email with Mozilla Thunderbird and Enigmail. | collapsible = | author = | developer = | released = | latest release version = 1.3.2 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2011|09|06}}<ref>[http://enigmail.mozdev.org/news/index.php.html The Enigmail Project News Archive]</ref> | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | frequently updated = | programming language = | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | platform = | size = | language = | status = | genre = Cryptography | license = [[Mozilla Public License|MPL]]/[[GNU General Public License#Version 2|GPLv2]]<ref>[http://enigmail.mozdev.org/home/license.php.html enigmail.mozdev.org]</ref> | website = http://enigmail.mozdev.org/home/index.php.html }} '''Enigmail''' is an [[List of Firefox extensions|extension]] for the [[Mozilla Application Suite]], [[SeaMonkey]] [[internet suite]] and [[Mozilla Thunderbird]] that provides [[Public-key cryptography|public key]] e-mail encryption and signing. Enigmail works under [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Unix-like]], and [[Mac OS]] [[operating system]]s. Actual [[cryptography|cryptographic]] functionality is handled by [[GNU Privacy Guard]].
Enigmail was first released in 2001 by Ramalingam Saravanan, and since 2003 maintained by Patrick Brunschwig. Both Enigmail and GNU Privacy Guard are [[Free Software|free]], [[open-source software]].
